pathAssistantSteps.info:
Move to Booked once the sales order creation is created in ERP, therefore part of the backlog. 

Update all key fields with the latest data, focus on product name, price, quantity, Close Date;

The Probability % for Won is 100% (Closed)

Move to Cancelled when the customer cancels the project;

The Probability % for cancelled is 0% (Omitted)

Move to Confirm when all sales activities have been completed & pending customer decision

Register all your sales activities & attach the quotation ;

Update the product, price, quantity & validate Close Date & ensure Lead Time is sufficient;

Split the opportunity into Parent & Child opportunities (with dates) if split invoicing is needed;

Set the Probability % to match your confidence level of winning this deal: the default probability for Confirm is 50% (Best Case)

Move to Develop when customer needs are identified; 

Register Opportunity Team Members and identify Contact Roles;

Register your sales activities (calls, tasks, events) and assign activities to other team memers; 

Update the product details; 

Set the Probability % to match your confidence level of winning this deal: the default probability for Develop is 30% (Pipeline)

Move to Finalise when the customer has given verbal/email commitment to HRC (still pending PO document);

Register/Upload the customer confirmation for the proposal/quote offered;

Update the product, price, quantity & validate Close Date & ensure Lead Time is sufficient;

Split the opportunity into Parent & Child opportunities (with dates) if split invoicing is needed;

If you receive a Customer PO, upload this document to the opportunity record; 

Set the Probability % to match your confidence level of winning this deal: the default probability for Finalise is 80% (Commit)

Create an opportunity when a qualified lead expresses interest in Hill-Rom;

Use opportunity naming convention: 2-letter country code + Account name + Product/Project name;

Select a product with expected product price and quantity (exact details are not important at this stage);

Set the Probability % to match your confidence level of winning this deal: the default probability for Identify is 1% (Omitted)

Move to Lost when the customer selects another supplier;

Complete your loss analysis;

The Probability % for Lost is 0% (Omitted)

Move to Won when the PO document has been received (still pending back-office team to process the sales order);

Update product, price, quantity. Critical to ensure total revenue is as close to PO value as possible. This impacts your (sales) closed & quota amount tracking, and facilitates back-office order processing;  

Attach the PO to the opportunity record;

Complete your win analysis;

Notify your back-office team to process the order in ERP: share the unique salesforce Opportunity Ref. No.;

The Probability % for Won ia 100% (Commit)
